title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.14.35 - 36 | 18-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Jai Vanarottamam
Devim Saraswati Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from
two verses which are given together in the Srimad Bhagavatam
35 and 36 verses of the 14th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
Mangalaya Cha Lokanam Kshemaya Cha Bhavaya Cha
Aaste Yadu Kulam Bodhav
Adyo Ananta Sakha Pumaan
Yad Bahudanda Guptayam Swapuryam Yadavor Chitaha
Kshemaya Cha Bhavaya Cha
Kreedanti Param Aanandam MahaPavuchika Iva
the meaning of these two verses given together
the original personality of godhead the enjoyer
and Balaram the primeval lord Ananta
are staying in the ocean of the Yadu dynasty
for the welfare
protection
and general progress of the entire universe
and general progress of the entire universe
and general progress of the entire universe
See this description. Krishna and Balaram are staying in the Yadu dynasty for the welfare,
protection and general progress of the entire universe. That is the position of the Lord.
The members of the Yadu dynasty being protected by the arms of the Lord are enjoying life
like the residents of the spiritual sky.
This completes the meaning of the two verses. Now Prabhupada explains elaborately the comparison
made here. It's a beautiful comparison to help us understand how Krishna ultimately
is the protector of all of us. In the Parpochala Prabhupada says, as we have discussed many
times,
The personality of Godhead Vishnu resides within each and every Universe in two capacities
namely as the garbhodaka shayi Vishnu and the kshirodhaka shayi Vishnu. If you remember
3 Vishnu forms in the material existence, out of which two are within the universe,
and the one is outside all the universe.
Student is asking a question.
universes. The outside of all the universes is Maha Vishnu, one supreme form, supreme
Lord's form is Vishnu, one form. Whereas Garbhodaka Shai Vishnu, the number of forms
of Garbhodaka Shai Vishnu are as many universes as there are. Garbhodaka Shai Vishnu enters
into each universe. There are millions of universes. And Kshirodaka Shai Vishnu enters
into the heart of every living being on each universe. Billions and trillions of living
beings on each universe and billions and billions of universes. So we cannot count all this.
It's all very, very, very large numbers. The Kshirodaka Shai Vishnu has his own universe.
His own planet on the northern top of the universe. That's called Shwetadvipa. And there
is a great ocean of milk. Shwetadvipa means ocean of milk. Dvipa means an island. Island
is always in the middle of an ocean. Now, in this great ocean of milk, the Lord resides
as Kshirodaka Shai Vishnu on the bed of the Ananta incarnation of Baladeva.
Vishnu resides on the bed of Anantadeva. Anantashayana. He is also called the Anantashayana Lord.
Thus Maharaj Yudhishthira has compared the Yadu dynasty to the ocean of milk, Shri Balaram
to Ananta, where Lord Krishna resides. He has compared the citizens of Dwarka to the
liberated Yadu dynasty. He has compared the citizens of Dwarka to the liberated Yadu dynasty.
He has compared the inhabitants of the Vaikuntha lokas. You see the comparison done by Yudhishthira
so beautifully explained by Prabhupada. So Prabhupada says about the Vaikuntha lokas,
he says, beyond the material sky, further than we can see with our eyes, material sky
we can see with our naked eyes, but beyond that and beyond the sevenfold coverings of
the universe, each universe.
The universe consisting of millions of planets has got several coverings, seven layers of
coverings. The coverings are very very very very big. If you consider the entire universe
as a huge ball, then if the diameter of our universe is described as four billion miles,
diameter of the universe. Now, the thickness of the first layer of covering of the universe
is ten times the diameter of the universe. That means it is forty billion miles thick.
Forty billion miles thick, the first covering. The second covering over the first covering
is ten times thicker than the first covering. So, if the first covering is forty billion
miles thick, the second covering is four hundred billion miles thick. So, we cannot even imagine
how thick the coverings are and progressively the coverings keep on becoming thicker, thicker,
ten times more, ten times more, ten times more than the previous covering. So, the second
covering is four hundred billion miles thick. The third covering is four thousand billion
miles thick. And then for forty thousand billion miles like that, it goes, it's very
very thick covering. So, beyond these coverings, there is the causal ocean in which all the
universes are floating like footballs. So, just imagine this situation of this supreme
Lord in the spiritual world. Just try to imagine by these descriptions. We are tiny beings
on this insignificant earth planet among millions of planets in the universe. And the universe
is one insignificant universe among millions of universes in the entire material creation.
And the entire material creation itself with all the universes and each universe with all
the planets and each planet with all the living beings is one insignificant portion of the
spiritual sky. So beyond all this, there is the causal ocean in the spiritual sky, one
corner of the spiritual sky, there is causal ocean. In that ocean these universes are floating
like footballs.
Beyond the causal ocean, there is an unlimited span of spiritual sky. Beyond the causal ocean.
And that is generally known as the effulgence of Brahman, Brahmajyoti. In Sanskrit, it's
called Brahmajyoti. In English it is called Effulgence of Brahman.
Within this effulgence, effulgence means that glow within this effulgence, there are innumerable
spiritual planets and they are known as Vaikuntha planets. Vaikuntha means where there is no
anxiety, where there is no misery, where there is no suffering, where there is no material
inebriety, no material imperfection, perfect spiritual situation. So each and every Vaikuntha
planet is many many times bigger than the biggest universe within the material world.
So how can we even conceive what is the spiritual world? We can't even conceive, it is inconceivable.
At least accept it is inconceivable by these descriptions, factual descriptions. And in
each and every one of them, each and every one of the Vaikuntha planets, there is no
deity. There are innumerable inhabitants who look exactly like Lord Vishnu. Lord Vishnu
in his four-handed form is there in every Vaikuntha planet as the predominating deity.
There are many many many many inhabitants, they are all devotees, pure devotees. They
all have forms which look exactly like Lord Vishnu. These inhabitants are known as the
Mahapaulukas.
So, that reference was made by Yudhishthira, comparing the citizens of Dwarka to Mahapaulukas.
So, who are these Mahapaulukas? They are the inhabitants of the Vaikuntha locus. Now,
these Mahapaulukas are called as persons directly engaged in the service of the Lord in his
personal abode. They are happy in those planets and are without
any kind
of misery. And they live perpetually in full youthfulness, enjoying life in full bliss
and knowledge, without fear of birth, death, old age or disease, and without the influence
of Kala or eternal time. So, material world means full of miseries, fundamental miseries
– birth, death, disease, old age – full of the influence of Kala, eternal time. So,
time destroys everything systematically, whatever was created in this material world.
That influence of time is not there in the spiritual world. That influence of the four
miseries, fundamental miseries, is not there in the spiritual world.
Maharaj Yudhishthira has compared the inhabitants of Dwarka to the Mahapaulukas of Vaikuntha
loka, because even in Dwarka, all the citizens are so happy with the Lord and the Lord is
happy. Just like the Mahapaulukas are eternally happy, even the citizens of Dwarka are happy
in the Dwarka city, living with Krishna and Balarama.
In the Bhagavad Gita, there are many references to Vaikuntha lokas and they are mentioned there
as Madhama or the kingdom of the Lord.
In the Bhagavad Gita, there is a reference to Vaikuntha loka, not directly mentioned
as Vaikuntha. But Krishna says, yad gatva na nivartante tad dhama paramam mama – having
gone where one never returns to this material world of repeated birth and death, but lives
in the spiritual world with Krishna or with Narayana or with Vishnu, eternal life full
of bliss and knowledge.
That is described by Krishna in the Bhagavad Gita as his supreme abode because every place
belongs to Krishna, even the material world belongs to Krishna because it is a part of
his material energy – his material energy. All energies are his – Krishna's. So material
world also is Krishna's but it is an inferior place. Krishna does not reside here permanently.
He sometimes comes to this world.
He sabia akic aren't rabindranayatna, to
to attract all of us, to go back to him in his personal abode, supreme abode, mad-dhama.
So that's the description of the Bhagavad Gita.
Parastasmat bhavo anyo avyakto avyaktatsanatanah
Beyond, vyakta and avyakta, beyond manifest and unmanifest matter, there is an eternal existence.
Krishna says in the Bhagavad Gita.
In the 8th chapter, yad gatva nani vartante tad dhama param amma
So that is the supreme abode of the Supreme Lord described in the Bhagavad Gita briefly,
but details are given in the Bhagavad Gita and other scriptures.
So I'll stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
